match.title: 2nd ODI
match.statusText: South Africa won by 7 wickets (with 11 balls remaining)

dismissalText.commentary: Raqibul Hasan c Smith b Langeveldt 63 (105b 4x4 0x6 129m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: tame end to a controlled innings.... Langeveldt bowls this one slightly short on offstump, the ball stops on the batsman as he tries to pull that over mid-on, he doesn't get the elevation as the ball lands down Smith's throat at mid-on

headshotImage.caption: Andre Nel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andre Nel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalComment.html: chopped on.... adjusts to a slightly fuller length on off and middle, Tamim attempts to slice it through the off side but is cramped for room as he ends up chopping it onto his stumps, the legstump is pegged back

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Superb judgment at the boundary.... Nel bangs it in short outside the offstump, Ashraful is tempted into the hook, he fails to get the desired elevation to clear long-leg and Albie Morkel runs across from fine leg, fixes his gaze on the ball and takes it on the slide with both hands just inches away from the rope

headshotImage.caption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the mindgames have worked for Nel after sledging him the previous ball.... Nel pitches it on the corridor outside off, Nafees pokes at the ball half heartedly and a thin edge is taken easily

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Nel does the trick... Pitches that on a good length just wide of offstump, Razzak goes for an expansive cover drive on the up but ends up getting a thin outside edge to de Villiers

headshotImage.caption: Charl Langeveldt player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Charl Langeveldt player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: pitches on a good length on off and middle and shoots through low to Nazimuddin who's caught at the crease, the ball catches him flush in front of middle stump. Untimely dismissal for Bangladesh just when Nazim was in good rhythm

dismissalText.commentary: Dhiman Ghosh run out (Duminy/de Villiers) 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: appeal and lots and lots of confusion! Ghosh steers it with soft hands towards cover and sets off, he turns back as the fielder swoops the ball and flings it back to de Villiers who collects it with one hand and whips off the bails in one motion. Aleem Dar initially decided against calling for a replay but replays showed that Ghosh was well short of his ground. For a moment there was confusion and coach Mickey Arthur at the dugout near the boundary couldn't comprehend why that wasn't referred. Finally, common sense pevailed and Dar called for assistance.

dismissalText.commentary: Mosharraf Hossain run out (Morkel/Nel/de Villiers) 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Mortaza gives room and pushes it to Morkel at long-off, Mosharraf wanted a second run but Mortaza wasn;t interested as Morkel picks it up and throws it in a flash to the bowler, Nel swoops it back to the keeper and de Villiers whips off the bails while Mosharraf was halfway down the pitch

dismissalComment.html: Do we have a match here?.... Razzak gives it plenty of air outside off and cuts back the pace, Smith is induced into the cover drive but lunges too far from his body, he only succeeds in dragging the ball onto his stumps

dismissalComment.html: trapped on the pads and Gibbs isn't too pleased with the decision.... Mortaza curves it towards the pads, Gibbs shuffles and tries to work it to the on side and the ball catches him on the pads in the region of legstump, the umpire Aleem Dar convinced and Gibbs gives him a look. Was there an inside edge? Maybe

headshotImage.caption: Andre Nel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andre Nel player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: and he seals it with a six.... steps down to a gentle offering from Tamim, lofts it over his head for a big six

commentPostTextItems.html: South Africa have sealed the series 2-0 and are just one victory away from gaining the top rank among one-day teams.

Comfortable win in the end. The pair managed to negate the advantage held by the spinners after three wickets fell. Both were patient enough to gauge the turn and force the singles, though the boundaries were hard to come by. Mohammad Ashraful made the mistake by not attacking enough and as a result, the batsmen were easily able to  push the singles to long-off and long-on in particular.

Bangladesh appeared to let it all slip away. The century stand between Raqibul and Shakib is their biggest positive from this match. Perhaps chasing won't be a bad idea if Ashraful wins the toss again in Mirpur on Friday.
That's it from us here. Thanks for stopping by. This is Kanishkaa signing off. Cheers!

commentTextItems.html: full and wide outside off, he drives through the line to deep cover

commentTextItems.html: strays on the pads, he gets across and shuffles to midwicket
gives him a bit of width outside off, he punches it through the covers
he stays back at the crease and defends to mid-off
de Villiers is in no hurry as he defends back to the bowler
stays back and plays dangerously close to the body and stumps, he dabs it down to third man for a single
gets forward and drives through the line to long-on

headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: tries to flick and gets an inside edge onto his pads
gets forward and cuts to short third-man
tries to slog sweep and misses
spin, bounce and turn,... that pitches on off on a shortish length, turns in sharply, Duminy weaves away from the stroke and the ball beats him and the keeper

commentPreTextItems.html: There's a brief interruption in play as someone flings a missile onto the field. Someone's very unhappy here. No injuries though

commentTextItems.html: rocks back and tucks it away towards midwicket
goes for another heave across the line, he connects but doesn't get the elevation to reach the boundary, the ball lands safe near deep midwicket

shuffles and tucks it wide of short midwicket
stays back at the crease and whips it to the on side

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Raqibul Hasan c Smith b Langeveldt 63 (105b 4x4 0x6 129m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: tame end to a controlled innings.... Langeveldt bowls this one slightly short on offstump, the ball stops on the batsman as he tries to pull that over mid-on, he doesn't get the elevation as the ball lands down Smith's throat at mid-on

headshotImage.caption: Andre Nel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andre Nel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: JP Duminy headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: JP Duminy headshot

headshotImage.caption: AB de Villiers headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: AB de Villiers headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Dhiman Ghosh run out (Duminy/de Villiers) 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: appeal and lots and lots of confusion! Ghosh steers it with soft hands towards cover and sets off, he turns back as the fielder swoops the ball and flings it back to de Villiers who collects it with one hand and whips off the bails in one motion. Aleem Dar initially decided against calling for a replay but replays showed that Ghosh was well short of his ground. For a moment there was confusion and coach Mickey Arthur at the dugout near the boundary couldn't comprehend why that wasn't referred. Finally, common sense pevailed and Dar called for assistance.

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak c de Villiers b Nel 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Nel does the trick... Pitches that on a good length just wide of offstump, Razzak goes for an expansive cover drive on the up but ends up getting a thin outside edge to de Villiers

headshotImage.longCaption: AB de Villiers headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Mosharraf Hossain run out (Morkel/Nel/de Villiers) 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Mortaza gives room and pushes it to Morkel at long-off, Mosharraf wanted a second run but Mortaza wasn;t interested as Morkel picks it up and throws it in a flash to the bowler, Nel swoops it back to the keeper and de Villiers whips off the bails while Mosharraf was halfway down the pitch

headshotImage.longCaption: Andre Nel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalComment.html: chopped on.... adjusts to a slightly fuller length on off and middle, Tamim attempts to slice it through the off side but is cramped for room as he ends up chopping it onto his stumps, the legstump is pegged back

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Superb judgment at the boundary.... Nel bangs it in short outside the offstump, Ashraful is tempted into the hook, he fails to get the desired elevation to clear long-leg and Albie Morkel runs across from fine leg, fixes his gaze on the ball and takes it on the slide with both hands just inches away from the rope

headshotImage.caption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the mindgames have worked for Nel after sledging him the previous ball.... Nel pitches it on the corridor outside off, Nafees pokes at the ball half heartedly and a thin edge is taken easily

dismissalComment.html: pitches on a good length on off and middle and shoots through low to Nazimuddin who's caught at the crease, the ball catches him flush in front of middle stump. Untimely dismissal for Bangladesh just when Nazim was in good rhythm

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith b Abdur Razzak 28 (44b 3x4 0x6 78m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: Do we have a match here?.... Razzak gives it plenty of air outside off and cuts back the pace, Smith is induced into the cover drive but lunges too far from his body, he only succeeds in dragging the ball onto his stumps

headshotImage.caption: Herschelle Gibbs player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Herschelle Gibbs player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Herschelle Gibbs lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza 3 (14b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 21.42

dismissalComment.html: trapped on the pads and Gibbs isn't too pleased with the decision.... Mortaza curves it towards the pads, Gibbs shuffles and tries to work it to the on side and the ball catches him on the pads in the region of legstump, the umpire Aleem Dar convinced and Gibbs gives him a look. Was there an inside edge? Maybe

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c & b Abdur Razzak 16 (27b 2x4 0x6 35m) SR: 59.25

dismissalComment.html: good reflexes.... flighted on off stump, Amla tries to scoop that firmly over the bowler's head but can't clear Razzak as he cups it with both hands over his head and takes it neatly

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith b Abdur Razzak 28 (44b 3x4 0x6 78m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: Do we have a match here?.... Razzak gives it plenty of air outside off and cuts back the pace, Smith is induced into the cover drive but lunges too far from his body, he only succeeds in dragging the ball onto his stumps

notes: Bangladesh innings
Power Play 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0

HM Amla running for AB de Villers

milestones.description: Shakib and Raqibul Hasan's 119-run partnership is BAN's highest for the 5th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 116 between Ashraful and Shakib

stories.title: Batsmen must deliver - Ashraful
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Mohammad Ashraful, the Bangladesh captain, said his batsmen needed to perform better to give their team a chance of winning

stories.title: Nel and de Villiers star in series win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: South Africa came one step closer to usurping Australia as the No. 1 one-day side in the world with a comfortable seven-wicket victory in Mirpur

stories.title: Conditions to favour spin again
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Bangladesh will once again employ three spinners as they head to Mirpur for the second ODI against South Africa
